DEGREE SPOTLIGHT

Middle Tennessee State University has more than 300 graduate and undergraduate majors and concentrations to help our students reach their career goals. Below you will find ten of our most popular undergraduate programs spotlighted for your review.

Aerospace

College of Basic and Applied Sciences

UNDERGRADUATE

Aerospace is one of the most fascinating and well-paid industries in the world with many exciting jobs opportunities available for individuals of all skill levels and experience levels—from mechanics to pilots to dispatchers and more! Aerospace is a massive business that offers a wide variety of interesting choices for professional growth and advancement.

While the professional pilot program is one of the most popular programs at MTSU, you can choose from six different concentrations within the aerospace program to fit your precise interests.

Nursing

College of Behavioral & Health Sciences

UNDERGRADUATE

Nurses are the most trusted healthcare professionals today and work in various roles in the healthcare facility and in the community. Their day-to-day activities are generally focused on helping others, improving the health and well-being of others, and saving lives. Nurses have great responsibilities but also find great reward and personal fulfilment in their work.

Nurses can make a real difference in someone’s life and experience a very high level of career satisfaction. The opportunities are boundless.

Audio Production

College of Media and Entertainment

UNDERGRADUATE

With the nation’s highest-ranked audio production program, our students experience an environment to learn, develop, create, and thrive across multiple areas of audio. Students are taught by internationally recognized, award-winning faculty in highly equipped studios and labs and are encouraged to take advantage of our internship opportunities.

You will develop critical skills to understand sound and use audio principles and techniques in a variety of applications, including recording, journalism, sound design for television and theatre, and radio production and programming.

Psychology

College of Behavioral and Health Sciences

UNDERGRADUATE

Studying psychology helps you master interpersonal communications which often contributes to a more successful career in any field. Psychology reaches into multiple areas of human activity, from the workplace to schools, research hospitals to forensic investigation, as those trained in the field strive to understand and serve human needs.

The four primary goals of psychology are to describe, explain, predict, and change behavior. Students develop critical-thinking skills, people skills, and communication skills that they can apply to any field.

Computer Science

College of Basic and Applied Sciences

UNDERGRADUATE

Computer Science graduates enter an exciting career field that sees a rapid growth rate and commands high salaries. MTSU graduates are valued by employers such as Google, Microsoft, Meta, HCA, Schneider Electric, Deloitte, and Caterpillar.

The professional computer science concentration has earned the ABET accreditation which provides assurance that a college or university program meets the quality standards of the profession for which that program prepares graduates. Students may also choose the Business Application concentration.

Biology

College of Basic and Applied Sciences

UNDERGRADUATE

The world needs biologists more than ever as we face new and increasingly important challenges such as increasing population pressures, environmental concerns, food shortages, emerging diseases, and other issues.

Biology helps us better understand the characteristics and the impact of external influences, both short-term and long-term, upon the continuing processes of life in our world. You may choose from five different concentrations to fit your specific interests.

Business Administration

Jennings A. Jones College of Business

UNDERGRADUATE

Business Administration is the work of managing resources and people to meet an organization’s goals.

This program combines courses in management, marketing, economics, finance, and business law, offering students a broad knowledge of the functional areas of a company and how they connect to one another.

MTSU’s Jennings A. Jones College of Business is one of the top 1.5% of business schools in the world.

Recording Industry

College of Media and Entertainment

UNDERGRADUATE

The Recording Industry Music Business program is a home for those students who wish to play a role in the music industry. Whether it is managing artists, promoting tours, marketing, or being involved in other ways, this program could be a great fit for you. In a program centered around students, real-world experiences and professional contacts are an essential part of learning.

You may also consider the Commercial Songwriting concentration.

Art

College of Liberal Arts

UNDERGRADUATE

Studying art encourages self-expression and creativity. Art, as a part of a well-rounded education, can contribute to academic, career, and personal success, and can also build confidence as well as a sense of individual identity. Art majors are exposed to cross-disciplinary projects and collaborations in both traditional and non-traditional materials with the ability to experiment in today's ever-evolving art fields.

With a variety of concentrations from which to choose, you can identify the area which is of specific interest to you.

THE UNIVERSITY OF OPPORTUNITIES

Anna

Anna Davidson

Fashion Merchandising

"I am on a first name basis with most of my peers in my classes because we are in all the same classes together every semester."

Jordan

Jordan Hensley

Early Childhood Education

"When I toured campus, that is when I realized I really wanted to be there, I felt at home immediately and I knew from that one experience that MTSU was the school for me"

Ezekiel

Ezekiel Thompson

Aerospace and Music

"I decided to pursue two degrees simultaneously, in my search for universities it quickly became clear MTSU was a great choice since they have amazing programs in both music and aerospace"

Matthew

Matthew Nowak

Video & Film Production

"We have an awarding winning faculty and staff and we have many many award winning alumni and actually award winning students that still attend."

Dominic

Dominic Marcoaldi

Philosophy

"They had the philosophy program and the linguistics study minor that I really wanted to take a part in and the offered with affordable tuition."

Vanessa

Vanessa Camarena

Accounting

"Accounting major with PR and Interactive Media and Business Admin as my minors, whatever you want to do, I am sure MTSU has a program for it, and you'll be very happy."

Leah

Leah Louallen

Professional Studies

"I wanted to find a school that appreciated my prior experience while also maintaining the integrity of their academic programs. I really felt MTSU did that"

Lightning the mascot embraces every opportunity to meet fans and students.

We invite you to join the true blue family!

Recording Industry students hone their skills on professional equipment in several on-campus studios and labs, including the Chris Young Café.

In the Makerspace in the library, students can collaborate on projects or engage in their personal creative pursuits.

MTSU celebrates graduates in Commencement ceremonies in Murphy Center three times a year.

Dance students showcase their skills in dance concerts each fall and spring.

The True Blue Bridge connects the Student Services and Admissions Canter to the Student Union Building.

With 17 Division I sports teams, MTSU’s athletics offer fun and excitement for everyone

The MTSU blue horse shoe is a favorite spot for photos and meeting up with friends.

With more than 20,000 students, MTSU is a large campus but maintains a small-town feel.

LIFE AT MTSU

It’s always a good time to meet up at the Student Union, home to the bookstore, dining, a game room, a theater, and more.

Billboard ranks MTSU’s recording industry program among the nation’s top music business schools.

Aerospace students spend hours in the skies over MTSU and beyond, flying planes from the program’s 44-craft fleet.

Women’s and men’s basketball teams play in Murphy Center, a historic arena that’s hosted Elvis Presley, Tina Turner, U2, and many others.

We invite you to join the true blue family!

The MTSU blue horse shoe is a favorite spot for photos and meeting up with friends.

Lightning the mascot embraces every opportunity to meet fans and students.

LIFE AT MTSU

It’s always a good time to meet up at the Student Union, home to the bookstore, dining, a game room, a theater, and more.

EXPLORE MTSU

From the acclaimed academic programs and state-of-the-art facilities to MTSU campus life and our thriving

Blue Raider athletic programs, there are thousands of reasons Middle Tennessee State University

might be the perfect college choice for you.
